chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard D. Amundson #631503 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Cause Mental/BodilyHarm, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant shall receive credit for time served.  Sentence shall run consecutive to any other imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No contact with victim J.C.H. or his family.  No contact with anyone under the age of 18 including family members unless approved by agent.  No contact with Ms. Harsh without her consent or approval of agent.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Submit DNA sample.  Defendant shall comply with Criminal Thinking, Sex Offender Treatment and Psychological counseling as deemed appropriate.  Defendant shall comply with Sex Offender Registry.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
